MCMC diagnostics for the source attribution algorithm

Source: R/diagnostics.R
source.attribution.mcmc.diagnostics.Rd

MCMC diagnostics for the source attribution algorithm

source.attribution.mcmc.diagnostics(mcmc.file, mc = NULL,
  control = list(burnin.p = 0.2, regex_pars = "*", credibility.interval =
  0.95, pdf.plot.n.worst.case.parameters = 10, pdf.plot.all.parameters =
  FALSE, pdf.height.per.par = 1.2, outfile.base = gsub("\\.rda", "",
  mcmc.file)))

Arguments

mcmc.file

Full file name to MCMC output from function source.attribution.mcmc
mc

MCMC object from function source.attribution.mcmc; this can be specified alternatively to `mcmc.file`.
control

List of input arguments that control the behaviour of the source attribution algorithm:

  • "burnin.p"Proportion of MCMC iterations that are removed as burn-in period.

  • "regex_pars"Regular expression to select the parameter names for which diagnostics are computed. The default is all parameters, which is '*'.

  • "credibility.interval"Width of the marginal posterior credibility intervals.

  • "pdf.plot.n.worst.case.parameters"Integer which specifies the number of parameters with smallest effective sample size that are inspected in detail. If set to 0, worst case analyses are not performed.

  • "pdf.plot.all.parameters"Flag which specifies if traces shall be plotted for all parameters. If set to TRUE, very large pdfs may be created.

  • "pdf.height.per.par"Most plots show diagnostics with parameters listed on the y-axis. This value controls the plot height in inches for each free parameter.

  • "outfile.base"Start of the full file name for all output files.

Value

Nothing. Diagnostic plots and csv files are written to disk.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
